revised_title: Electrostatic Imaging in Radiology: Advancements and Limitations
tldr: This article discusses the use of electrostatic imaging methods, such as xeroradiography and ionography, in medical and industrial applications. It explores the limitations and future prospects of these techniques, focusing on their sensitivity, resolution, contrast, convenience, and economy. The article also highlights the advantages of xeroradiography in medical applications, such as mammography, venography, and arteriography, and discusses potential improvements in selenium plate technology.
